body_html: How do you know that they are thrown if they aren’t caught? IIRC I had some problems with those tests because py2 thrown the warning only once, while py3 did that every time. A better fix would be to disable those two lines in py2.
body_text: How do you know that they are thrown if they aren’t caught? IIRC I had some problems with those tests because py2 thrown the warning only once, while py3 did that every time. A better fix would be to disable those two lines in py2.
body: How do you know that they are thrown if they aren’t caught? IIRC I had some problems with those tests because py2 thrown the warning only once, while py3 did that every time. A better fix would be to disable those two lines in py2.
